intro: Rhynchospermum subsessile, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Rhynchospermum subsessile is adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
